alert.note: Alert for Kit Carson County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 28 at 1:54AM MDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Kit Carson County through 245 AM MDT... At 153 AM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Stratton, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Heavy rainfall and localized flooding. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...1-3 inches of rainfall has already fallen in the area. Additional rainfall may produce localized flooding, especially in flood prone areas. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of south central Kit Carson County. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
